result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin Edward Hedgecock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is eligible for programs after serving 60 days of prison.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

supervisions.notes: Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary.

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Plea/sentencing hearing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:34 AM Defendant Benjamin Edward Hedgecock in court by video in custody with attorney Walter H Isaacson by video.  Cheniqua White appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. Presentence investigation waived. Court orders 1 year prison and 1 year extended supervision. Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program after serving 60 days prison. Driver's license revoked for 2 years and IID for 2 years.  Complete AODA and all treatment/counseling as necessary. A fine of $600 and costs due DOC collect.  Sentence credit 111 days.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.
